abstract: Amazon becomes first digital streaming service to win best television series Golden Globe award with show Transparent; four major broadcast networks win none, highlighting changes in television landscape.
lead_paragraph: A nemesis for publishers, Amazon collected a Golden Globe for “Transparent,” becoming the first digital streaming service to win one for best TV series.

byline.contributor: Emily Steel reported from Los Angeles, and Jonathan Mahler from New York. Brooks Barnes contributed reporting from Los Angeles.
byline.original: By EMILY STEEL and JONATHAN MAHLER

snippet: A nemesis for publishers, Amazon collected a Golden Globe for “Transparent,” becoming the first digital streaming service to win one for best TV series.

headline.main: With Win, Amazon Shakes Up Yet Another Industry
headline.seo: Award for ‘Transparent’ Vindicates Amazon’s TV Executives
headline.print_headline: With Win, Amazon Shakes Up Yet Another Industry
